    "let @xmath0 be an elliptic curve over @xmath1 with complex multiplication by the ring of integers @xmath9 of an imaginary quadratic field @xmath10 .",
    "let @xmath2 be an odd prime number such that @xmath0 has good ordinary reduction at @xmath2 .",
    "then @xmath2 splits completely in @xmath10 with @xmath11 , where @xmath12 is a prime element of @xmath10 .",
    "let @xmath13 be the galois extension generated by the @xmath12-torsion points on @xmath0 and @xmath14 the @xmath15-extension of @xmath13 generated by the @xmath12-power torsion points on @xmath0 .",
    "then greenberg ( @xcite , p.  365 ) shows that @xmath14 has @xmath16-invariant greater than or equal to @xmath17 , where @xmath18 is the @xmath9-rank of @xmath1-rational points @xmath6 .",
    "there are at least two possible natural directions in the generalizations of the results of greenberg .",
    "the first generalization is on the higher dimensional cm abelian varieties , which is obtained by fukuda - komatsu - yamagata @xcite .",
    "the second generalization is on non - cm elliptic curves , which is the aim of this paper .",
    "let @xmath2 be an odd prime number .",

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> let @xmath0 be an elliptic curve over @xmath1 with prime conductor @xmath2 . for each non - negative integer @xmath3 we put @xmath4)$ ] . </S>",
    "<S> the aim of this paper is to estimate the order of the @xmath2-sylow group of the ideal class group of @xmath5 . </S>",
    "<S> we give a lower bound in terms of the mordell - weil rank of @xmath6 . as an application of our result </S>",
    "<S> , we give an example such that @xmath7 divides the class number of the field @xmath5 in the case of @xmath8 for each positive integer @xmath3 .    </S>",
    "<S> elliptic curve , mordell - weil rank , class number . </S>"
  ]
